Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • Bank
  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    Bank class is like a middle man between bank accounts and model. This also has the list of bank and the accounts we are logged in to.
    Since:
    ?4/04/2022
    Author:
    Minas Fakhori

      a variant of addBankAccount which makes the account and adds it all in one go.
      boolean addBankAccount​(BankAccount a)
      a method to add a new bank account to the bank - it returns true if it succeeds or false if it fails (it never fails, in this implementation)
      boolean changePassAuth​(int newAccPasswd, long dob)
      This method checks if the user input is the same as the actual password and the date of birth before you can your password.
      boolean deposit​(int amount)
      This deposits amount into acount if the loggedIn method returns true, it calls the account instance (from BankAccount class) method depsoit.
      int getBalance()
      This gets the balance if the loggedIn method returns true, it calls the account instance (from BankAccount class) method getBalance.
      int getOverDraft()
      This gets the overdraft if the loggedIn method returns true, it calls the account instance (from BankAccount class) method getOverDraft.
      boolean loggedIn()
      This method simply checks wether your logged in or not using a simpel if statment, to check if it is equals to null
      boolean login​(int newAccNumber, int newAccPasswd)  
      void logout()
      This method resets bank to be null - logged out state.

      This is a method to create new BankAccounts, using the factory method rather than using the new keyword directly
      void newPass​(int newPass)
      This method takes the current password and changes it with another password.
      boolean withdraw​(int amount)
      This withdraws amount from acount if the loggedIn method returns true, it calls the account instance (from BankAccount class) method withdraw.

      • makeBankAccount

        public BankAccount makeBankAccount​(int accNumber,
                                   int accPasswd,
                                   int balance,
                                   int overDraft,
                                   long dob)
        This is a method to create new BankAccounts, using the factory method rather than using the new keyword directly
        Parameters:
        accNumber - (int) BankAccount account number
        pinPsswd - (int) BankAccount acount password
        balance - (int) BankAccount the balance for that account
        overDraft - (int) BankAccount the overdraft limmit for that account
        dob - (long) BankAccount the date of birth for the person that owns that bank account
        Returns:
        accNumber, accPasswd, balance , dob

      • addBankAccount

        public boolean addBankAccount​(BankAccount a)
        a method to add a new bank account to the bank - it returns true if it succeeds or false if it fails (it never fails, in this implementation)
        Parameters:
        a - BankAccount
        Returns:
        true

      • addBankAccount

        public boolean addBankAccount​(int accNumber,
                              int accPasswd,
                              int balance,
                              int overDraft,
                              long dob)
        a variant of addBankAccount which makes the account and adds it all in one go. Using the same name for this method is called 'method overloading' - two methods can have the same name if they take different argument combinations

      • login

        public boolean login​(int newAccNumber,
                     int newAccPasswd)
        Parameters:
        newAccNumber - checks if the account number is the same as is the same as the actual account
        newAccPasswd - checks if the password is the same as is the same as the actual password for that account
        Returns:
        true/false

      • changePassAuth

        public boolean changePassAuth​(int newAccPasswd,
                              long dob)
        This method checks if the user input is the same as the actual password and the date of birth before you can your password. To use this method you call it in the model and give it two paramiters one int and the other long and make it do something if it returns true or false This is used to change your password, but can be modifed to use it for other things. It uses a simple if statments to check if both the account password and the date of birth are correct.
        Parameters:
        newAccPasswd - (int) checks if the password for that account is the same as the number the user gives.
        dob - (long) checks if the date of birth is the same as what the user has entered (<= this is done in the model)
        Returns:
        true/false

      • newPass

        public void newPass​(int newPass)
        This method takes the current password and changes it with another password. You use this in the model and call the method and pass the new int password
        Parameters:
        newPass - (int) the new password

      • logout

        public void logout()
        This method resets bank to be null - logged out state.

        public boolean loggedIn()

        Returns:
